010package imagingbook.common.noise.hashing;
011
012/**
013 * Hash functions for gradient (Perlin) noise.
014 * 
015 * @author WB
016 * @version 2022/11/24
017 */
018public abstract class Hash32 implements HashFunction {
019        
020        private static final int maxInt = 0x7fffffff;
021        
022        private static final int[] smallPrimes = {      // used for N-dimensional hashing
023                73, 79, 83, 89, 97, 101, 103, 107, 109, 113,
024                127, 131, 137, 139, 149, 151, 157, 163, 167, 173, 
025            179, 181, 191, 193, 197, 199, 211, 223, 227, 229,
026            233, 239, 241, 251, 257, 263, 269, 271, 277, 281, 
027            283, 293, 307, 311, 313, 317, 331, 337, 347, 349, 
028            353, 359, 367, 373, 379, 383, 389, 397, 401, 409 
029        };
030        
031        final int seed;
032        
033        protected Hash32(int seed) {
034                this.seed = HashFunction.getRandomSeed(seed);
035        }
036        
037        /**
038         * "Hashes" an <tt>int</tt> key to a "pseudo-random" <tt>int</tt> value in
039         * [-2147483648, 2147483647]. This method is to be implemented by concrete
040         * subclasses.
041         * 
042         * @param key key to be hashed
043         * @return a integer value in [-2147483648, 2147483647].
044         */
045        abstract int hashInt(int key);
046        
047        @Override
048        public double hash(int u) {
049                int h = hashInt(73*u + seed) & maxInt;
050                return (double) h / maxInt;
051        }
052        
053//      public double[] hash(int u, int v) {
054//              int hx = hashInt(59*u + 67*v + seed) & maxInt;  
055//              int hy = hashInt(73*u + 79*v + seed) & maxInt;  
056//              return new double[] {(double) hx / maxInt, (double) hy / maxInt};
057//      }
058        
059        // call 1 hash function and extract 12-bit blocks 
060        @Override
061        public double[] hash(int u, int v) {
062                final int M = 0x00000FFF;
063                int h = hashInt(59*u + 67*v + seed);
064                int hx =  h & M;                // extract bits  0..11
065                int hy = (h >> 12) & M; // extract bits 12..23
066                return new double[] {(double) hx / M, (double) hy / M};
067        }
068        
069        // call 3 different hash functions for 3 dimensions
070//      public double[] hash(int u, int v, int w) {
071//              int M = 0x7FFFFFFF;
072//              int hx = hashInt(59*u + 67*v + 71*w + seed) & M;
073//              int hy = hashInt(73*u + 79*v + 83*w + seed) & M;
074//              int hz = hashInt(89*u + 97*v + 101*w + seed) & M;
075//              return new double[] {(double) hx/M, (double) hy/M, (double) hz/M};
076//      }
077        
078        
079        // call 1 hash function and extract bit blocks
080        @Override
081        public double[] hash(int u, int v, int w) {
082                final int M = 0x000000FF;
083                int h = hashInt(59*u + 67*v + 71*w + seed);
084                int hx =  h & M;                        // extract bits 0..7
085                int hy = (h >> 8) & M;  // extract bits 8..15
086                int hz = (h >> 16) & M; // extract bits 16..23
087                return new double[] {(double) hx / M, (double) hy / M, (double) hz / M};
088        }
089        
090        /*
091         * N-dimensional permutation hash; this version does not use any bit splitting.
092         * Instead, the hashInt() function is applied repeatedly for every gradient
093         * dimension by using the dimension number (k) as a local seed - in addition to
094         * the global seed (seed).
095         */
096        @Override
097        public double[] hash(int[] p) { 
098                final int N = p.length;
099                double[] g = new double[N];
100                for (int k = 0; k < N; k++) { // dimension k
101                        int sum = seed;
102                        for (int l = 0; l < N; l++) { // dimension k
103                                sum = sum + smallPrimes[l + k] * p[l];
104                        }
105                        int h = hashInt(sum + k) & maxInt;
106                        g[k] = (double) h / maxInt;
107                }
108                return g;
109        }
110
111}
